citations.narrative:
The harbor seal at the zoo has been housed alone since the death of its harbor seal companion in May 2023. Although
the zoo is actively looking to acquire harbor seal(s) to provide a social living environment, there is no written plan for the
singly housed harbor seal approved by the Attending Veterinarian developed in consultation with the husbandry and
training staff as required per this Section of the Regulations.
Marine mammals that are known to be primarily social in the wild must be housed with at least one compatible animal of
the same or biologically related species unless it has been determined that such housing is not in the best interest of the
marine mammal’s health or well-being. Animals that are housed separately must have a written plan developed in
consultation with the husbandry/training staff and the plan must be approved by the Attending Veterinarian. The plan must
include the justification for the length of time the animal will be kept separated or isolated, include information on the type
and frequency of enrichment and interaction, and include provisions for periodic review of the plan by the Attending
Veterinarian. Correct by 9/2/23.
This inspection and exit briefing were conducted with facility representatives.
*END OF REPORT*
